Name: PRODUCT INQUIRY: Oil Stain on Wood
Description:
Hi %First Name%

Thank you for reaching Scentiment Customer Support. I'm %Agent First Name%, and I would be glad to assist you today.

I'm truly sorry to hear about the oil stains caused by our scent diffusers. Removing oil stains from wood furniture can indeed be a bit challenging, but there are some friendly and effective workarounds you can try, most of which require ingredients commonly found in your kitchen:

1. Paper Towel Blotting:
If the oil stain is fresh, gently blot it with paper towels to absorb as much oil as possible. Avoid rubbing, as it might spread the stain further.

2. Baking Soda or Cornstarch:
Sprinkle either baking soda or cornstarch onto the stain, allowing it to sit for several hours or overnight. These powders can help soak up the oil. Afterwards, simply brush or vacuum away the powder.

3. Dishwashing Detergent:
Create a mild soapy solution by mixing a few drops of dishwashing detergent with water. Dampen a cloth with this solution and delicately blot the stain. Rinse the area with a clean, damp cloth and pat it dry.

4. Vinegar and Water:
Blend equal parts of white vinegar and water to create a vinegar-water mixture. Dampen a cloth with this solution and gently blot the stain. Finish by rinsing with a clean, damp cloth and patting it dry.

I hope one of these methods proves helpful in addressing the oil stains on your wood furniture. If you have any further questions or need additional assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out. We genuinely value your satisfaction and are here to help.

As always, feel free to reach out to us should you need further assistance.

All the best, %Agent First Name%Scentiment Customer Support

Name: Troubleshooting: Standard Diffuser V1: Cleaning Written Instructions & Video
Description:
Hello %First Name%,

Thank you for reaching out! Diffusers should be cleaned every 15 to 30 days. To do so, please see the instructions below or watch this instructional video guide.
1. Fill the empty oil bottle that came with your diffuser with 1/4 inch of rubbing alcohol.
2. Screw the alcohol-filled bottle into the diffuser.

4. Unplug the device from the wall outlet and keep the diffuser in an upright position. Wipe the device with a damp cloth to remove oil stains and fingerprints. Avoid using any harsh or abrasive cleaning products.
5. Remove the alcohol-filled bottle, insert the fragrance oil of your choice, reconnect both halves of the diffuser, and plug it into the wall outlet.

Name: TUTORIALS: Set up: Standard Scent Diffuser V1: Setting Up Your Scent Diffuser written step by step & video
Description:
Hello %First Name%,
Thank you for reaching out! I am happy to help get your Scent Diffuser set up! We've just made a comprehensive video on how to set up your Standard Scent Diffuser, watch it here. But below is a step-by-step procedure you can follow as well:

Step 1: Opening the Diffuser
Open the Scentiment diffuser by rotating the upper half counterclockwise while holding the bottom half firmly.

Step 2: Removing the Empty Bottle
Remove the empty Scentiment bottle by turning it clockwise from the top part of the diffuser.

Step 3: Adding the Scenting Oil
Screw the chosen scenting oil bottle counterclockwise into the diffuser, ensuring it is tightly secured, OR pour the contents of an oil bottle into the provided bottle.
Only fragrance oils that come in a 50ml or 120ml bottle can be directly plugged into the diffuser without pouring it into the included bottle.

Step 4: Closing the Diffuser
Close the unit tightly by sliding the upper half back into place and turning it clockwise.

Step 5: Connecting the Power Adapter
Plug the power adapter into a 110V power outlet.

Step 6: Understanding the LED Lights
The blue light shows when the device is powered on, the green light shows when the device is diffusing oil, and red flashing when using the remote control.
Power on the device and show the blue light

Turn the misting on and show the green light

Use the remote to demonstrate the flashing red light

Step 7: Powering On and Off
Use the "On/Off" button on the remote control to power the device.

Step 8: Adjusting Aroma Density
There are "Density +" and "Density -" buttons on the remote control.
Density + (plus) - Increases aroma’s density by 10%. Press 10 times for maximum density
Density - (minus) - Decreases aroma’s density by 10%. Press 10 times for minimum density

Step 9: Activating Continuous Operation
By pressing the "Aroma" button you'll activate the continuous operation of the diffuser.

You can adjust the density using the density buttons.

 

Step 10: Controlling Scenting Intervals
Scent intervals are provided on buttons L1 - L6

Step 11: Understanding Scenting Intervals
You will see one of the following settings, depending on the remote you have:
L1 (25%)- Diffuser will diffuse scent for 40s and pause for 160s
L3 (50%)- Diffuser will diffuse scent for 100s and pause for 100s
L6 (95%) - Diffuser will diffuse scent for 180s and pause for 10s

OR

20% 16sec misting, 60sec pause
35% 16sec misting, 120sec pause
50% 16sec misting, 180sec pause
65% 16sec misting, 240sec pause
80% 16sec misting, 300sec pause
95% 16sec misting, 360sec pause

Step 12: Setting the Timer
You can use the remote to select your preferred timer options, which are 1 hour, 4 hours, and 8 hours.

Name: TUTORIALS: Set up - Mini Scent Diffuser: Setting Up Mini Diffuser - Step by step & video
Description:
Hello %First Name%,
Thank you for reaching out! I am happy to help get your Scent Diffuser Mini set up! You can watch the detailed video here or follow the step-by-step procedure below. 
Step 1: Touch Screen Display
You'll use the display screen to control the mist timer settings and device timer settings.
By default, the Mini works continuously for 4 hours and then turns off automatically. However, you have the flexibility to shut it off after a shorter amount of time between 1 to 3 hours. It offers three timer options to control the mist frequency. First one being 120 seconds of misting following a 60-second pause, the 2nd being the 60-second misting, followed by a 2-minute pause. Lastly, a 15-second misting, followed by a 2 and a half minute pause.

Step 2: Removing the Bottle
In order to pour your fragrance, you must first access the fragrance bottle inside the Mini. In order to do so, you’re going to reach under the bottom of the diffuser and find an opening where you’re able to push up the bottom of the bottle until the motor lid pops up. Pull the lid up away from the diffuser and unscrew the bottle from it.
Step 3: Filling the Bottle
Unscrew the empty oil bottle and fill it with the desired Scentiment fragrance oil.
Ensure that the filled bottle is securely and correctly installed back in to the nozzle.

Step 4: Reinstalling the Nozzle
It’s very important to align the arrow indicators on the nozzle and the diffuser together before pushing it back, otherwise you won’t be able to open it again and may cause damage to the device.

Step 5: Important Notes and Features
In order to power the device on / off you will need to press and hold the power button for 2 seconds each time.
You can switch between the misting frequency by pressing the power button once for each of the three options: 15 seconds, 60 seconds or 120 seconds.
Press and show settings switching between 15s, 60s and 120s.
Hold the timer button for 2 seconds to switch between the three timer settings with three options (1h, 2h, 3h).
This device has a memory function that retains the chosen settings even when the device is turned off and back on.

Name: TUTORIALS: Set up: Scent Diffuser Pro V1: Written Step by Step and Video
Description:
Hello %First Name%,
Thank you for reaching out! I am happy to help get your Scent Diffuser Pro set up! Here's a comprehensive video tutorial you can watch. Otherwise, you can also follow the step by step guide below: 
Step 1: Loading the Oil
Use the included key to unlock the door on the side of the machine and remove the oil container.

Take the 200 mL scent oil bottle and unscrew the top and fill it will your preferred oil.

Connect the oil bottle to the system, ensuring the tube inside fits inside the oil bottle.

Thread the oil bottle into the machine securely.

Close the door and lock it.

Step 2: Setting Time and Date
Power on the unit.

Check if the time and date are correct on the LCD screen.

To change the time, press the set button once to change the hours, press again to change the minutes.

To change the day, press the set button a third time and use the up and down buttons to select the desired day.

Press the set button to confirm the selection.

The volume screen will appear, leave it at 200 and press the set button.

The level screen will appear, leave it at 200 and press the set button.

The milliliters per hour screen will appear, leave it at 10.0 (adjust by holding the up button and press set when it reaches 10.0).

Once the correct time and date are set, the system is ready for scheduling.

Step 3: Setting the Schedule
Press the mode button once to enter schedule mode.

The first schedule event, "Event 1," will appear.

Press the set button to set the start time.

Use the set button to change hours and minutes accordingly.

To select which days the event will operate, use the up button to add or remove arrows for each day.

Press the mode button to move to the end time of the schedule.

Use the set button to set the end time.

Press the mode button to lock in the first schedule.

Step 4: Scent Dispensing Settings
Set the initial scent duration to 30 seconds by pressing the mode button.

Set the pause duration to 160 by pressing the mode button again.

If desired, set additional schedules following the same steps.

Step 5: Monitoring Oil Level
The green light indicates a full bottle, blue indicates half a bottle, and red indicates it's time to replace the bottle.

Step 6: Loading a New Bottle
When loading a new bottle, ensure the volume and level settings are set back to 200.

Press the set button until reaching the "Bi" screen and set it to 200.

Press the set button again until reaching the "Level" screen and set it to 200.

Press the set button twice more to exit the settings.

Please let us know if you have any other questions! 

Regards,%Agent First Name%Scentiment Customer Support

Hi %Customer Name% ,

Thanks for reaching out! We know it’s frustrating when your diffuser isn’t working, and we’re here to help get it back to normal as quickly as possible. Rest assured, we’ll make sure it’s working properly for you.
To start, could you kindly check a couple of things:
Check for airflow: Please confirm if you can feel any airflow coming out of the misting hole when the diffuser is in operation. Gently lift the diffusion head, locate the small hole, and place your finger over it to check for air pressure. If you do not feel any air pressure, please let us know so we can arrange a replacement motor pump for you.

If you do feel air pressure: Try poking the misting hole with the provided pipe. Insert it into the misting hole at the top of the diffuser head. This helps release the anti-leak ball inside, which can sometimes get stuck and block airflow. See Attached photo below as a reference.

Name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Diffuser Air 2 – Oil Leaking
Description:
Hi %Customer Name%,
Thanks for reaching out! We understand how frustrating it can be when your diffuser is leaking, and we’re here to help get it back to normal as quickly as possible. Rest assured, we’ll make sure it’s working properly for you.
To start, could you kindly check a couple of things:
Check Oil Level: Make sure the oil bottle is filled just below the shoulder line to prevent spills.

Clean Diffuser Parts: Soak the nozzle and pipe in diffuser cleaner or isopropyl alcohol for 5 minutes, then reattach.

Release the Anti-Leak Ball: try poking the misting hole with the provided pipe. Insert the pipe into the misting hole and gently press down to release the anti-leak ball, which can sometimes get stuck and cause leaking.

Name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Diffuser Air 2 – Not Turning On
Description:
Hi %Customer Name%,
Thanks for reaching out! We know it’s frustrating when your diffuser won’t turn on, and we’re here to help get it working properly again. Rest assured, we’ll guide you every step of the way.
To start, could you kindly check a couple of things:
Check Remote and Power Button: Press any button on the remote and check if the small LED lights up red. If it does, the remote has power. Ensure the plastic tab on the bottom of the remote has been removed and the battery is installed correctly.

Check Charging: Use the USB-C cable that came with your diffuser to charge it fully (up to 4 hours). The LED should pulse green while charging.

Check Power Button: Make sure the power button isn’t loose or unresponsive.

If the diffuser still doesn’t turn on, or if the LED lights up but there’s no mist or airflow, you may want to check the No Mist or No Airflow troubleshooting steps.

Name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Diffuser Air 2 – Keeps Turning Off
Description:
Hi %Customer Name%,

Thanks for reaching out! We understand how frustrating it can be when your diffuser keeps shutting off. Don’t worry—we’ll help get it working smoothly again.
To start, could you kindly check a couple of things:
Check Diffuser Settings: The single button near the charging port cycles through three misting levels:
Low: Mists for 15 seconds, pauses for 90 seconds

Medium: Mists for 30 seconds, pauses for 60 seconds

High: Mists for 60 seconds, pauses for 30 seconds

The diffuser is designed to automatically shut off after 8 hours of total run time.*
Check Charging: Make sure you’re using the USB-C cable that came with your diffuser. When plugged in, the LED strip should gently pulse green.

Power Issue: If your diffuser continues turning off or pulsing even after charging fully, try unplugging and plugging it back in.

Name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Mini Diffuser 2 LE – No Mist
Description:
Hi %Customer Name%,

Thanks for reaching out! We know it’s frustrating when your Mini 2 LE isn’t producing mist, and we’re here to help get it working properly again. Rest assured, we’ll guide you through the steps.
To start, could you kindly check a couple of things:

Check Airflow: Remove the oil bottle from the diffuser. Turn the diffuser on and place your finger near the airflow hole inside the hollow area at the top. If you feel air pressure, the pump is working.

Use Spare Parts (if available): Remove the nozzle using the provided tool and check the gasket. If the gasket is missing, please let us know. Install the replacement nozzle and pipe from your spare parts kit.

Clean Old Parts (if no spare parts): Soak the nozzle and pipe in diffuser cleaner or isopropyl alcohol for 5 minutes. Then reattach and flush the system with a cleaner for about 3 minutes. Once done, refill the oil bottle and power on your diffuser.

For additional guidance, here’s a video showing how to troubleshoot your Mini 2 LE, including how to check airflow: YouTube Guide

Name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Mini Diffuser 2 LE – Keeps Turning Off
Description:
Hi %Customer Name%,

Thanks for reaching out! We know it’s frustrating when your Mini 2 LE keeps turning off, and we’re here to help get it working properly again.

To start, could you kindly check a few things:
Check Diffuser Settings: Your Mini 2 LE has a single button that controls mist intensity. Each tap cycles through three misting levels:
Low: Mists for 15 seconds, pauses for 90 seconds

Medium: Mists for 30 seconds, pauses for 60 seconds

High: Mists for 60 seconds, pauses for 30 seconds

Battery Life & Auto Shut-Off: The diffuser is designed to automatically turn off after 8 hours of total runtime. Depending on your misting level, the battery lasts 12–30 hours.

Custom Schedules (Optional): You can install the Scentiment app to create custom misting schedules. Keep in mind that each schedule is also subject to the 8-hour total runtime.

Check Charging: Make sure you are using the USB-C cable that came with your diffuser. When plugged in, the front LED should softly pulse green. If it continues to pulse even after 4 hours of charging, please let us know. 

After charging, power on the diffuser.

Name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Mini Diffuser 2 LE – Not Turning On
Description:
Hi %Customer Name%,

Thanks for reaching out! We understand how frustrating it can be when your diffuser won’t turn on, and we’re here to help get this sorted out as quickly as possible.
To get started, please try the steps below:
Check Charging & Power: Make sure you’re using the USB-C charging cable that came with your Mini Diffuser 2 LE. Plug the diffuser into a working power source and let it charge for up to 4 hours. While charging, you should see a soft pulsing green light on the front of the diffuser.

If the light is still pulsing after 4 hours, please let us know so we can help further.
Inspect the Power Button: Check the top surface of the diffuser for any oil, dust, or residue that may interfere with the touch-sensitive power button. Gently wipe the surface clean, then try turning the diffuser on again.

LED On but No Mist or Airflow: If the diffuser powers on and the LED lights up but there’s still no mist or airflow, this may be related to a no-mist issue. In that case, please follow the no-mist troubleshooting steps below.
